name: Michelle Williams (singer)
description:
'''Tenitra Michelle Williams''' (born July 23, 1979) is an American singer and actress. She rose to fame in the early 2000s as a member of R&B girl group [[Destiny's Child]], one of the [[List of best-selling girl groups|best-selling female groups of all time]] with over 100 million records, of which more than 60 million copies sold with the trio lineup that included Williams. During her time in the group she earned several accolades including a [[Grammy Award]] and a star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]].

During the group's two-year hiatus, 2001–2003, Williams released her debut solo album ''[[Heart to Yours]]'' (2002) which topped the US [[Gospel music|gospel]] album chart. That same year, ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' named Williams the fifth top-charting gospel artist of the year and she received a [[MOBO Awards|MOBO Award]] for "Best Gospel Act". Following this, she released her second solo album ''[[Do You Know (Michelle Williams album)|Do You Know]]'' (2004). After Destiny's Child's disbandment in 2006, Williams released her first pop album, ''[[Unexpected (Michelle Williams album)|Unexpected]]'' (2008), which spawned the singles "[[We Break the Dawn]]" and the [[Dance Club Songs|US Dance]] number-one "[[The Greatest (Michelle Williams song)|The Greatest]]". Her fourth studio album, ''[[Journey to Freedom (album)|Journey to Freedom]]'' (2014), received positive reviews and became her highest-charting album in the US; it includes the singles "[[If We Had Your Eyes]]", and "[[Say Yes (Michelle Williams song)|Say Yes]]" which topped the US [[Hot Christian AC|Hot Gospel Songs]] chart for seven weeks, and won the [[Stellar Awards|Stellar Award for Music Video of the Year]].

Williams has also ventured into acting, appearing in television, [[Broadway theater|Broadway]], and [[West End theatre]] productions. Making her acting debut on Broadway in ''[[Aida (musical)|Aida]]'' (2003), she has since starred in the sitcom series ''[[Half & Half]]'' (2006) and the musical productions ''[[The Color Purple (musical)|The Color Purple]]'' (2007), ''[[Chicago (musical)|Chicago]]'' (2009–10), ''[[David E. Talbert|What My Husband Doesn't Know]]'' (2011) ''[[Fela!]]'' (2013) and the original Broadway production of [[Death Becomes Her (musical)|''Death Becomes Her'']] (2024). In addition, she received a nomination for "[[NAACP Theatre Award for Best Lead Female – Equity|Best Lead Female – Equity]]" in 2008 at the 18th Annual [[NAACP Theatre Awards]]. Williams was a featured judge on ''[[MTV's Top Pop Group]]'', a contestant on [[Strictly Come Dancing (series 8)|season 8]] of ''[[Strictly Come Dancing]]'' in the United Kingdom, and has also appeared on the  [[The Masked Singer (American TV series)|American]], [[The Masked Singer (British TV series)|British]], and [[The Masked Singer (Australian TV series)|Australian]] versions of ''[[The Masked Singer]]''.
